artist: Claes Janz. Visscher II; after Maarten de Vos
creditline: Gift of James A. Bergquist, Boston, in honor of Rachel McGarry
inscription:
in plate, at bottom: Cantica.2.1
In plate, lower right: 2
text: The scene takes place in a garden surrounded by a balustrade, an enclosed garden symbolizing purity untainted by the ways of the world. Here Christ meets his bride, an allegorial figure of the Catholic Church (or perhaps simple Faith) .They stand beneath a fruit-bearing tree. It is as if the union of Christ and the Church will undo the chaos that followed Adam and Eve's consumption of the fruit in the Garden of Eden. To the left is a priest holding the tablets of God's law. Another man holds a goat, a symbol of sacrifice, here probably alluding to the Crucifixion. To the right is Solomon with his entourage.
title: Plate 2, from The Song of Solomon
